description: Analyses, specifies, updates and makes available a model to implement applications in accordance with Information Services (IS) policy and user/customer needs. Selects appropriate technical options for application design, optimising the balance between cost and quality. Designs data structures and builds system structure models according to analysis results through modeling languages. Ensures that all aspects take account of interoperability, usability and security. Identifies a common reference framework to validate the models with representative users, based upon development models (e.g. iterative approach).
title: Application Design

levels.1: Contributes to the design and general functional specification and interfaces.
levels.2: Organises the overall planning of the design of the application.
levels.3: Accounts for own and others actions in ensuring that the application is correctly integrated within a complex environment and complies with user/customer needs.

knowledges.K1: requirements modelling and need analysis techniques
knowledges.K2: software developments methods and their rationale (e.g. prototyping, agile methods, reverse engineering, etc.)
knowledges.K7: Database Management System (DBMS), Data Warehouse, DSS... etc

skills.S3: apply estimation models and data to evaluate costs of different software lifecycle phases
skills.S4: evaluate the use of prototypes to support requirements validation
skills.S5: design, organise and monitor the overall plan for the design of application
skills.S6: design functional specification starting from defined requirements
skills.S7: evaluate the suitability of different application development methods for the current scenario
skills.S8: establish systematic and frequent communication with customers, users and stakeholders
skills.S9: ensure that controls & functionality are built in to the design
skills.S2: collect, formalise and validate functional and no-functional requirements
